By default, the profit effect is not selected, and the tax will not have an effect on the portfolio's profit or will not be included in the portfolio's purchase value.

title: Tax type information
body: Cash

title: Tax type information
body: The selection tells whether the tax type has a cash effect. The cash effect determines whether this type of tax has an effect on the portfolio's cash, i.e. is the amount of the tax deposited to or withdrawn from the portfolio's account with the transaction. By default, the cash effect is selected, and the tax has the same effect on the portfolio's account as the transaction does. If not selected, only the net price of the transaction without the tax of this type would affect the portfolio's cash.

title: Add a column based on a key figure
body: You can add custom columns based on key figures into the different search views and Analytics+. To learn how to do this, follow the instructions below.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: You can modify the definition of an existing key figure or define a new one. The hard-coded security key figure and portfolio key figure definitions are available to view but not modify.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: To define a new key figure, do the following:

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: Click Add new key figure.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: Fill in the fields. For field descriptions, see Preference - Content and translations in FA Back.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: Click Save.

title: Modify key figure definitions
body: You can modify key figure definitions after saving. However, if you modify an existing key figure that already has values stored for contacts, portfolios, or securities, the values are preserved but may not be modified anymore. For example, if you change a key figure from "contact" to "portfolio", you cannot modify the key figure values for contacts.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: You can add key figure values for contacts, portfolios, or securities by entering them manually in the respective windows or by importing them.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: To add key figure values manually in FA Back, do the following:

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: Open the Key figures tab in the Contact, Portfolio, or Security window.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: On the left side of the tab, select the key figure and click Add new value.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: Define the date and value.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: Click Add.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: For more information about importing key figures, see File formats for importing securities and security prices and File format for importing portfolios in FA Back reference.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: To configure a key figure as an Analytics+ column, do the following:

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Open Preference → Content and translations → Analytics+ columns.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Click Add new column and fill in the fields:

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select how you want to define the column - Select "Based on a security key figure".

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Code* - A unique code for the column. You can't change the code after saving.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Name* - Name for the column.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Description - Optional description of the column content, shown when selecting columns in Analytics+.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Link - Optional link for more information about the column, shown when selecting columns in Analytics+.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select the security key figure you want to use as a column - Choose the key figure to link to the column from the dropdown list.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select how to calculate values on group levels -

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Do you want to override the default formatting? Choose if you want to specify a custom formatting for the column. If you select "Yes, override formatting", you also need to specify the format.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Click Save.

title: Add a task type to FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor has a set of standard task types (calls, emails, letters, and meetings) you can work with, but you can also create your own task types. The following instructions describe how to create a task type in FA Developer and make it available to users in FA Advisor.

title: Step 1 - Create a form
body: Create a new form by following the instructions in Create a form. Note down the Form ID, because it is needed in the next step.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: After creating a form for the task type, you need to create a process:

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Go to Workflows → Process modeler and click Create process.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Fill in the fields for the new task type and click Create new model.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Model name. Enter a name for the task type to be displayed in FA Advisor.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Model key. Give an identifier for the task type.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: In the process editor, create a process with at least a start event, an activity (for example, user task), and an end event. To learn more about creating user tasks, see Create a contact.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click on the activity you created and enter the Form ID from the previous step in the Form key field.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Form key. Enter the Form ID from the previous section.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Category. Enter "FAADVISOR".

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Name. Enter the task type name.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Assignments. Choose which users the task can be assigned to by clicking the field and selecting "Fixed values". In the Candidate groups field, specify user groups by user role and separate groups with a comma (see Manage access to a workflow).

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click on the space outside the process and then on Target namespace. Enter "FAADVISOR" in the field.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click Save.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: The task type can now be included in the FA Advisor app to make it available to users.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: The final step of adding a task type is to make it available in FA Advisor:

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Go to Workflows → Process modeler → Apps and click on FA Advisor.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Open the App editor in the top right and then click Edit included models.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Select your task type to include it and click Close.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Click Save the app definition in the top left and tick the Publish? checkbox.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Click Save and close editor.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Your task type is now available in FA Advisor and can be assigned to users.

title: API integrations
body: GraphiQL is a query tool available in FA Developer App. The tool can be used to define queries and mutations. It features a GraphQL editor, as well as documentation for the available GraphQL endpoints.

title: API integrations
body: GraphQL API provides many customization opportunities, for example:

title: API integrations
body: Building an integration between FA and an external application. A good example of this would be an integration between FA and your version of FA Client Portal.

title: API integrations
body: Building a custom JSReport (for details about custom reports, see the Reporting section). JSReports use GraphQL API to fetch the report data from FA Back.

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app
body: The GraphQL API view provides you access to the GraphiQL client to run queries and mutations to the FA GraphQL API.

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app
body: The menu on the left shows the GraphQL endpoints you can access:

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app
body: Portfolio management (/graphql)

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app
body: Fund management (/services/fund/graphql)

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app
body: Reconciliation (/services/reconciliation/graphql)

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app
body: Type in the query and get the response on the right. Use the buttons at the top to toggle the display of panes:

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app

title: GraphQL API view in FA Developer app

body: GraphQL schema descriptions.

title: Contacts, portfolios, securities, transactions
body: When using API to fetch data from or import data into the FA system, the API fields and attributes need to follow the same structure as in the CSV files that you can import in FA Back, but without code prefixes. For example, when importing a contact name in a CSV file, you need to refer to the field as "c.name", but when importing the field via mutation API, you need to refer to it as "name". Fields that are required in CSV imports are also required via API. For more information about importing, see Importing in FA Back reference.

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: You can import or modify FA data via GraphQL mutation API. When you import an object (for example, a contact or a portfolio), you need to provide all required fields as parameters. The required fields and attributes are the same as in CSV import files, but they need to be referred to without their code prefixes (see Importing in FA Back reference).

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: When modifying an object, you need to provide the minimum information needed to identify the entity. The imported attributes are updated and attributes that you leave out preserve their previous values.

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: To import or modify different object types, use the following endpoints:

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: Contacts => importContacts

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: Portfolios => importPortfolios

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: Securities => importSecurities

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: Transactions => importTransactions

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: Trade orders => importTradeOrders

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: Security prices => importPrices

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: You can adjust the import behavior by using the importGeneral endpoint and specifying the import parameters you need:

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: rows : list of objects to import (required)

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: withRules : boolean whether to run rules when importing (default = false)

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: importAsync : boolean whether to use asynchronous importing or not (default = false)

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: mode / sMode / pMode / prMode / trMode / oMode / cMode : option to control import behavior for all object types (mode) or specific object type (sMode / pMode / prMode / trMode / oMode / cMode). Available options are:

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: 0 - insert and update (default)

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: 1- insert only

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: 2 - update only

title: Import and modify data via mutation API
body: Each endpoint can be used to import or update one or many objects in one request. The response identifies if the request was successful or if it had errors (specified in the response).

title: Define the request
body: For a valid request such as the example below which shows how to import, you need to define the mutation endpoint to use and all the required fields and attributes. The required fields in this case are "Contact ID", "Name", "Type", "Juridical form", "Status", "Tax country", "Classification", and "Identity" (see File format for importing contacts in FA Back reference).

title: Define the request
Define the request
body: You can find an example of how to use importGeneral to control whether to run rules in Import data and trigger a business rule.

title: Interpret the response
body: The response structure is similar to the request. The result contains a list of map structures. Each item in the list represents an imported object. All attributes, including the ones not explicitly used in the request, are returned. The attributes have prefixes. For example, contact name is shown as c.name. The importStatus attribute indicates success with the value "OK".

title: Interpret the response
body:
{
  "data": {
    "importContacts": [
      {
        "c.marketingCommunication": "",
        "c.subType": "",
        "c.language": "",
        "c.type": "1",
        "c.taxCountry": "FI",
        "c.externalId": "",
        "c.memo": "",
        "c.country": "",
        "c.phone2": "",
        "c.phone1": "",
        "c.juridical": "PE",
        "c.representatives": "*** ,",
        "c.fax": "",
        "c.email": "",
        "c.extContactIdList": "",
        "c.name": "GraphQL contact",
        "c.status": "A",
        "c.profileAttributes": "",
        "c.classification3": "",
        "c.contactExchanges": "",
        "importStatus": "OK",
        "c.electronicCommunication": "",
        "c.classification2": "",
        "c.transactionExtIdLevel": "1",
        "c.address1": "",
        "c.address2": "",
        "c.tags": "",
        "c.nationality": "",
        "c.city": "",
        "c.classification": "PROF",
        "c.contactId": "GQL1",
        "c.identity": "ID",
        "c.zipCode": ""
      },...
  ]
}

title: Interpret the response
body: If required attributes are missing or the code is incorrect, the importStatus attribute value is "ERROR". Each attribute with an error shows "ERROR" (or ERROR:[ImportError.required] if the required value is missing).

title: Interpret the response
body:
{
  "data": {
    "importContacts": [
      {
        "c.marketingCommunication": "",
        "c.subType": "",
        "c.language": "",
        "c.type": "1",
        "c.externalId": "",

        "c.electronicCommunication": "",

title: Reconciliation
body: FA Operations lets you reconcile position and cash account data stored in FA with the data you receive from external sources, for example, from your custodian or a bank.

title: Reconciliation
body: Set up data sources. Set up FA Operations to receive reconciliation data from external sources. You can use multiple data sources for reconciliation, for example, if you reconcile positions and cash accounts, or if you receive position information from different custodians.

title: Reconciliation
body: Fetch reconciliation data in FA Operations. Fetch the data from you custodian.

title: Reconciliation
body: View reconciliations. View reconciled positions and cash accounts.

title: Reconciliation
body: Assign mismatches for further investigation.

title: Reconciliation
body: Fix a mismatch. You can fix a mismatch in the following ways:

title: Reconciliation
body: Correct the system data so that it matches external data.

title: Reconciliation
body: Have the mismatch corrected by your counterparty.

title: Reconciliation
body: Mark a mismatch as solved in case this is a known issue that you don't need to fix.

title: Reconciliation
body: Close reconciliations with known mismatches if needed.

title: Reconciliation
body: Track changes and view history.

title: Reconciliation
body: Download reconciliation reports for the whole reconciliation or for a chosen item.

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: A reconciliation in FA Operations can have the following statuses:

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: Open – The reconciliation data is received, and there are some mismatches.

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: Finished – The reconciliation contains no mismatches.

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: Closed – The reconciliation has some mismatches and was closed by the user.

title: What is compared
body: FA Operations lets you compare the following data:

title: Fetch reconciliation data in FA Operations
body: Depending on the custodian and the data format they provide, you can choose one of the following options to fetch the data to PA Platform:

title: Use bank or custody connection
body: You can fetch reconciliation data using FA standard integrations. At the moment, the following connections work with FA Platform:

title: Use bank or custody connection
body: Bloomberg AIM. To receive files from Bloomberg AIM, set up the connection in FA Back (see Setting up Bloomberg AIM integration).

title: Use bank or custody connection
body: DNB Bank and custody connection. To receive files from DNB, set up the connection in FA Back (see Set up DNB bank and custody connection).

title: Use bank or custody connection
body: M2 Wealth. To receive files from M2 Wealth, set up the connection in FA Back (see Set up M2 Wealth).

title: Upload MT535 files in FA Operations
body: If your reconciliation data is in MT535 format, you can upload it in FA by placing the file manually in the respective folder or configure a Camel route that fetches the file automatically. For details about creating a Camel route, see Import custom CSV files to FA.

title: Upload MT535 files in FA Operations
body: Once the file is in the folder, you can track the upload status: open the Reconciliation overview in FA Operations and click in the upper-right corner.

title: Use FA reconciliation format
body: If your custodian provides the reconciliation data in a format that is not supported by FA Platform, you need to transform the data into the standard FA format first.

title: Create a reconciliation file
body: If your custodian provides the reconciliation data in any other format than MT535, you need to transform the data into the standard FA format first.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: The reconciliation file in FA format is a CSV file with the following characteristics:

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: The default field separator is a semicolon. You can configure FA to accept files with a different separator. The separator must be only one character.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: The record separator must be \r\n (CRLF).

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: Numbers must use "." (point) as a decimal separator and no thousands separator.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: If the file contains non-standard characters, the encoding must be ISO-8859-1.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: File name can be any.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: The FA reconciliation needs to contain the following fields (use the field names as headers on the first row):

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: portfolio: Portfolio ID (as seen in the Portfolio window in FA Back).

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: date: Date in the yyyy-MM-dd format (having two or more different dates in the file results in an error task and the file isn't processed).

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: amount: Position amount or account balance.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: security: Any of securityCode / isin / tradeCode / updateCode1 / updateCode2 / updateCode3 is supported (either this or account is mandatory).

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: account: Account number.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: currency: Optional. It’s recommended to include currency in the reconciliation file - the system uses this information to match positions and cash accounts in different currencies, in case they have the same ID or account number.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: tradeAmountPf: Optional. Position purchase value in portfolio currency.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: tradeAmount: Optional. Position purchase value in security currency.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: marketTradeAmountPf: Optional. Position market value in portfolio currency.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: marketTradeAmount: Optional. Position market value in security currency.

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: Download the CSV file example:

title: FA reconciliation file format
body: fa_example_reconciliation_file.csv

title: Related links
body: Configure field separator for reconciliation files

title: Upload files in FA reconciliation format in FA Operations
body: You can upload a file in the FA reconciliation format from FA Operations or using a Camel route.

title: Upload file in FA Oprations
body: To upload the file in FA Operations:

title: Upload file in FA Oprations
body: Open the Reconciliation overview and click in the upper-right corner.

title: Upload file in FA Oprations
body: Select the file, choose the data source and click Upload.

title: Upload file in FA Oprations
body: You can track the upload status: open the Reconciliation overview and click in the upper-right corner.

title: Upload file with a Camel route
body: To upload the data with a Camel route, see Import custom CSV files to FA. The files should be place in the {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/inbound/[data source code] folder.

title: Set up data sources
body: Reconciliation data is uploaded in FA Operations in a file. In addition to fetching the data, you need to:

title: Set up data sources
body: Set up data sources. You can use multiple data sources for reconciliation, for example, if you reconcile positions and cash accounts, or if you receive position information from different custodians.

title: Set up data sources
body: (Optional) Set up handling positions that are missing from the data source. You can set up reconciliation to ignore all or certain positions that are present in an FA portfolio but are missing in the external data. This can be useful, for example, if you have several custodians, or if you have positions in certain securities that you always want to skip.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: To set up a data source:

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Open the Data sources view in FA Operations and click Add data source.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Fill in the fields and define the data fetching options:

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Data source name

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: The name of the data source. The data source name is visible in the Reconciliation overview.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Data source code

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: The code used to identify the data source. The data source code must match the name of the FA folder where the reconciliation file is uploaded. For example, if your reconciliation folder is .../nordea, the code must be "nordea". For standard integrations, use the following codes:

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Bloomberg AIM: aim_positions

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: DNB: default

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: M2 Wealth cash account reconciliation: m2_cash

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: M2 Wealth position reconciliation: m2_positions

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Match portfolios by

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: The portfolio property used to match portfolios from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options: Short name, External ID, Name, Book entry, Custom ID (Portfolio window, IDs tab).

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Match securities by

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: The security property used to match securities from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options depending on the identifiers you use: ISIN code, Security code, Trade code, Update code 1-3, Name.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Data delivery schedule

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: The schedule for fetching the external data to FA Operations. Choose the parameters in the fileds or enter the Cron expression in the advanced mode.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Use settled balances

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Compare only settled account balances.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Include subportfolios

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Include positions and cash accounts from subportfolios in the reconciliation.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Reconcile items not in the source data

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Identify mismatches if FA positions are missing in the external reconciliation file. If you receive position information from different custodians, turn off this setting to skip the positions missing in the custodian's file.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Date adjustment for data delivery

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: The delay in receiving the reconciliation data. For example, if the reconciliation file received today contains the data for the previous day, set the date adjustment as "1". If the file is received on the same day, set the date adjustment as "0".

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone used in the data delivery schedule.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Holiday calendar

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: A holiday calendar to take into account in the data delivery schedule, for example, a weekend calendar with Saturday/Sunday weekends. The holiday calendar is used to calculate the dates for upcoming reconciliations and notify the users if the data is missing. The list of available holiday calendars is configured in FA Back (see Preference - Securities).

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: Click Save.

title: Set up a data source in FA Operations
body: After you set up the data source, it is shown in the Reconciliation overview, Upcoming reconciliations. You can view the reconciliation items when FA Operations receives external data.

title: Handle positions missing in the data source
body: You can define how reconciliation handles positions that are present in FA Platform but missing in the custodian data. By default, position reconciliation shows a mismatch if it finds extra positions that are present in FA Platform but missing in your custodian's reconciliation file. You can change this behavior by excluding a portfolio or a security from reconciliation.

title: Handle positions missing in the data source
body: Ignore all extra positions in the specified portfolio – for example, if the portfolio contains positions from multiple custodians, and the reconciliation is done custodian-by-custodian. To set up this option, open the Portfolio window, Basic info tab in FA Back and enable "Reconciliation: Ignore extra positions in FA".

title: Handle positions missing in the data source
body: Ignore extra positions in a certain security in all portfolios – for example, if the reconciled portfolios include unlisted assets that are missing from the reconciliation file provided by your custodian. To set up this option, open the Security window, Basic info tab in FA Back and enable "Reconciliation: Ignore extra positions in FA".

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks and onboarding new customers. You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: Work with customers

title: About FA Advisor
body: Maintain up-to-date customer information. You can view your customers, or all customers in the system, and select an individual customer to view and edit their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Add customer-related notes and store documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related tasks: calls, emails, letters, meetings, or custom tasks that you define.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer investments

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a summary of a customer's investments or see more details in FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Trade for the customer via FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Keep track of unsigned trade orders that the customer needs to accept.

title: Work with customers
body: FA Advisor enables you to access customer profiles in the FA Platform to work with your customers. Customer profiles are created in FA Back as contacts, and FA Advisor allows you to maintain up-to-date information about a customer as well as manage tasks, documents, and notes related to them.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view allows you to view customer information in a table. To open a specific customer's details, click  in the Actions column. To access a customer's investments or trade on their behalf, click  in the Actions column to open the FA Client Portal app.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: Use the Customer groups dropdown to view different groups of customers. View customers you are linked to as a representative by selecting "My customers" (default selection), all customers in the system by selecting "All customers", or customers linked to a specific representative by selecting their name. You can also save your selection or set it as the default (see Adjust the view).

title: Viewing options
body: Export customers as a CSV or XLSX file by clicking Export.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view) and group the table information by certain columns (click on and then Group by).

title: Viewing options
body: Convert all visible currency values to a specific currency by selecting it in the Currency dropdown.

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter a name for the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view, including the search fields at the top. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: You can see the following information as columns in the Customers view or fields in the Customer details:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer’s address information.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Advisors

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's advisors (contacts with contact type 2 in FA Back). You can edit contact definitions under contact type 2 in FA Back (Preference → Contacts → Contact types).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Cash

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of cash in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. Customer ID can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Date of birth

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's date of birth.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in the FA Platform.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity format of the customer, for example passport. Identity can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Investments

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of investments, excluding cash, in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language of reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality of the customer. Nationality can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Order status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trade order status. If the customer has unsigned trade orders, the column shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represented by

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Persons who represent the customer and the tags specified for them in the customer profile. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can add representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represents

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Persons the customer represents and optional tags assigned to them. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status of the customer record in the system (active, passive, or closed). Customer status can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country of the customer. Taxation country can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Total assets

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Combined amount of cash and investments in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Transaction no. level

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Level at which the system generates transaction numbers. This is either the portfolio level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within the portfolio, or the contact level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within all of the contact's portfolios. Transaction no. level can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Manage notes and documents
body: The Notes and history section at the bottom of Customer details view allows you to add your customer-related notes, store documents like agreements or investment plans, maintain notes about customer meetings, and view completed tasks related to the customer. If the customer has a contact memo in FA Back, you can also see it in FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes and documents
body: To display notes in FA Advisor correctly, we recommend you use, for example, Google Chrome or Safari as your browser.

title: Manage notes
body: Manage notes

title: Add or download notes
body: In the Notes and history section, the Notes tab allows you to add notes related to the customer or meetings with the customer and link them to specific dates. Notes are also shown in FA Back Contact window, Documents tab. If you delete a note in FA Back, it is also deleted from FA Advisor.

title: Add or download notes
body: You can create meeting notes from templates uploaded in FA Back or from a blank note the same way you can create general notes. Notes are arranged into categories, including general notes, meeting notes, and any additional categories you create in FA Back (to create categories, see LINK in FA Admin guide).

title: Add or download notes
body: To add a note, do the following:

title: Add or download notes
body: Click Add note. To create a meeting note, select one of the meeting note templates or "Blank". To create a general note, select "Blank".

title: Add or download notes
body: Enter a name and date for the note. If you created a blank note, select the note Category.

title: Add or download notes
body: Enter the content in the text editor.

title: Add or download notes
body: Click Save.

title: Add or download notes
body: To download notes as text files, select them in the list and click Download. You can also print or save a note as a PDF by opening it and clicking the icon.

title: View and add note tabs
body: You can add general information about the customer in the Customer info tab in the Notes and history section. If you have stored information in the customer's contact memo in FA Back (in the Contact window), you can view a tab called FA Back note. Note that you can only edit or delete the memo in FA Back. You can also add new tabs in the Notes and history section.

title: View and add note tabs
body: To add a new tab, do the following:

title: View and add note tabs
body: Click + Add tab and enter a name for it.

title: View and add note tabs
body: Add content in the text editor.

title: View and add note tabs
body: Click Save.

title: Manage documents
body: Manage documents

title: Upload documents
body: In the Documents tab, you can see documents uploaded for the customer. You can track the signing status and check the FA Client Portal availability of each document. To add documents, do the following:

title: Upload documents
body: Click Upload and add the documents.

title: Upload documents
body: Fill in the fields: Category, Signing status, Show in FA Client Portal. See the field descriptions below.

title: Upload documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Upload documents
body: The document is uploaded. To edit the category, signing status, or availability in FA Client Portal for an uploaded document, click in the Actions column.

title: Available document information
body: For each document, you can see the following information:

title: Available document information
body: Category

title: Available document information
body: Document category, for example, agreement or investment plan. Document categories are defined as tags under "Document type" in FA Back (Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Available document information
body: Document name

title: Available document information
body: The file name. The supported file types are: PDF, DOC, DOCX, ODT, XLS, XLSX, PPT, PPTX, ODP, ODS, TXT, CSV, XML, PNG, JPG, RTF, and MP3.

title: Available document information
body: Uploaded by

title: Available document information
body: The user ID of the user who uploaded the document.

title: Available document information
body: Upload date

title: Available document information
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: Available document information
body: Signing status

title: Available document information
body: Document signing status: canceled, done, error, expired, pending or waiting. These document signing statuses are included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise statuses are defined in FA Back in Preference → Tags → Document tags under "Document signing". Documents are sent for signing in FA Back (see Document signing in User guide).

title: Available document information
body: FA Client Portal

title: Available document information
body: Document availability to customer in FA Client Portal, indicated with a checkmark. You can make a document available when uploading by ticking the Show in FA Client Portal checkbox. In FA Back, documents that are available in FA Client Portal are assigned the tag "Online" (included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise the tag is defined in Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Track document signing
body: When you upload documents, you can set their Signing status as pending ("Document signing-Pending" tag in FA Back) to make them appear as tasks in the Open tasks section, Customer tasks tab of the Customer details. When there are pending documents related to the contact, a portfolio or a trade order, you can track them in this tab.

title: Track document signing
body: You can see a list of documents pending signing in the table and the date when the documents were created. You can also download the pending documents in the Actions column.

title: Manage tasks
body: Advisor tasks allow you to plan and record your actions when communicating with a customer. You can schedule calls, emails, letters, and meetings, for example, and make notes related to them. You can also create other task types in the FA Developer app (see Add a task type to FA Advisor in FA Developer guide). Customer tasks are for tracking pending trade orders (see Track pending trade orders).

title: Manage tasks
body: The following sections describe how you can add advisor tasks, search for tasks, and mark tasks as completed.

title: Add a task
body: You can add a task related to a customer by doing the following:

title: Add a task
body: In the Customer details, Open tasks section, click Add task in the Advisor tasks tab.

title: Add a task
body: Select the task type (for example, call, email or letter, or meeting). Alternatively, you can click Add task in the Tasks view.

title: Add a task
body: Select the Assignee who should complete the task and define the Due date (for details, see Task information). You can also mark the task as completed.

title: Add a task
body: Click Save.

title: Work on tasks
body: When working with a customer, you can see open tasks related to them by going to the Customer details and viewing the Open tasks section. To view and manage all tasks assigned to you or any other user, go to the Tasks view. The Tasks view allows you to do the following:

title: Work on tasks
body: Search for tasks based on assignee, task type, and task status.

title: Work on tasks
body: View only tasks assigned to you by selecting "Assigned to me" in the Assignee filter.

title: Work on tasks
body: Open the task details by clicking the icon in the Actions column. You can:

title: Work on tasks
body: View the contact information of the customer or access their profile by clicking Open customer details.

title: Work on tasks
body: Change the task assignee by selecting a different user in the Assignee field.

title: Work on tasks
body: Change the task status by editing the Due date (future due date gives the task "Open" status, while past due date gives the task "Overdue" status).

title: Work on tasks
body: Mark the task as complete.

title: Task information
body: The following information is available for tasks:

title: Task information
body: Assignee

title: Task information
body: The user the task is assigned to. You can assign the task to yourself or another user by selecting them in the dropdown.

title: Task information
body: Customer

title: Task information
body: The name of the customer.

title: Task information
body: Creator

title: Task information
body: The user who created the task.

title: Task information
body: Due date

title: Task information
body: The date by which the task needs to be completed.

title: Task information
body: Note

title: Task information
body: Notes about the task.

title: Task information
body: Status

title: Task information
body: Task status ("Open", "Overdue", or "Completed"). The "Overdue" status is applied to tasks with a due date in the past. The "Completed" status is applied to tasks marked as complete.

title: Task information
body: Task type

title: Task information
body: Type of action. Standard advisor task types are call, email or letter, and meeting.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: After finishing a task, you can mark it as completed by doing the following:

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click the icon in the Actions column of a task to open the side pane.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Tick the checkbox Mark task as completed.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click Save.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: The task status changes to "Completed". You can view completed tasks in a separate tab in the Customer details view, Notes and history section.

title: Manage customer's investments
body: You can view a summary of customer investments in FA Advisor. You can also create trade orders on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. Trade orders are sent for execution after the customer signs them.

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details, you can view a summary of a customer's investments in the Investments section. You can view the investment summary for the customer's active portfolios in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: As a table by clicking . The table shows the portfolio name, ID, currency, and in the portfolio currency the value (existing holdings and executed amount) of securities, cash accounts, and market value. The portfolios are in alphabetical order by default, but you can sort the columns in ascending or descending order.

title: View customer's investments
body: As a pie chart by clicking , but only if the customer's portfolios are all in the same currency. The pie chart shows the name, ID, and total value of active portfolios. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are grouped together. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios in the same currency, the pie chart displays 9 portfolios and the remaining portfolios are grouped together.

title: View customer's investments
body: You can also access the customer's investments via FA Client Portal in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details view, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right.

title: View customer's investments
body: Open the Customers view and click the icon in the Actions column.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can buy, sell, or switch securities and make deposits and withdrawals on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. When making trade orders on behalf of the customer, you can also send them to be signed by the customer before execution. Make sure you have access to trading on behalf of customers and that sending documents for signing is enabled.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can only trade via FA Client Portal with portfolios in the group "ADV_TRADING" and securities in groups that start with "ADV_.". The groups are assigned in FA Back (see Security groups and Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: To trade on behalf of a customer, do the following:

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: In the Customers view, click the icon in the Actions column. Alternatively, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right of the Customer details. The customer's FA Client Portal opens.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure you have the rights to trade by checking the banner at the top of the view. Allowed actions are written in green with a check mark next to them.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make the trade order, deposit, or withdrawal. For information on how to make trade orders, deposits, and withdrawals, see FA Client Portal documentation.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: The trade order you created is tagged with "Advisor" in FA Back and has the pending signing status until the customer signs it. The customer's Status column in the Customers view now shows "Unsigned trade orders". The system sends the trade order to the customer for signing.

title: Cancel a trade order
body: You can cancel trade orders in the customer's FA Client Portal app. For details on how to cancel trade orders, see Orders view in FA Client Portal.

title: Track pending trade orders
body: You can keep track of the customer's pending trade orders in the Customer tasks tab of the Open tasks section in Customer details. Pending trade orders are listed as trade order signing tasks in the table. You can download documents related to the trade orders to your computer in the Actions column.

title: Set up CGT
body: this is the one-time setup topic for admins to configure CGT - these settings should be configured before starting to use CGT

title: Step 1 - Mark portfolio types and securities as eligible for CGT
body: portfolio types need to be eligible for cgt to work, same goes for securities

title: Step 2 - Configure contact information
body: you can also import cgt info for contacts

title: FA Invest
body: FA Invest

title: Analyze profit and loss
body: PnL view let you track key indicators, such as market value, profit, exposure, and so on. You can fine-tune the table to show the information you need.

title: Set up the table
body: To view the position data, set up the table – choose what positions, adjust the table rows and columns.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Choose the port to analyze and set the currency at the top of the view:

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Portfolio group

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Portfolio group to view. Portfolio groups are configured in FA Back.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Positions

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Positions to view:

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: All – Settled and unsettled positions.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Settled only – Only settled positions.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: With pending orders – Positions from pending trade orders, as well as settled and unsettled positions.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Currency

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: The currency to view position data.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Portfolio – Portfolio currency.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: <Currency code> – A currency from the list.

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: Include subportfolios

title: 1. Choose the portfolios to view
body: An option to show subportfolio positions as a part of the parent portfolio. Subportfolio positions are summed up with the parent portfolio positions. For including the subportfolios as individual positions, include the subportfolios separately in the portfolio group in FA Back.

title: 2. Select columns
body: Click Columns on the right and select the columns from Portfolio details, Security details and Position details. For the full list of columns, see Position data in the PnL view.

title: 3. Group position rows
body: You can group the positions rows – for example, on the screenshot above positions are grouped by portfolio, security types within the portfolio, and security currency. To set the grouping, drag the column name from the Columns pane on the right to the grouping row above the table.

title: 4. Filter and sort
body: To filter the rows in the table, click Filters on the right and select the filtering parameter. For example, you can filter out positions in a certain currency. You can also filter the values by clicking in the column header.

title: 4. Filter and sort
body: To sort the values from largest to smallest and vice versa, click the column header. You can also click three dots in the column header and choose the sorting option.
